channel.title: Free .com or .net domains from microsoft office live beta!
channel.description:
its true, i saw an add for it somewhere on the internet, and here it is! it is all completely free, and trusted, because its from microsoft. go to this url:
http://officelive.microsoft.com/?XID=AUS0707010930000F0A08K2468037289googleta
i just thought it was REALLY cool, so i shared it. watch the video thingy, and then sign up!!!
im already getting my own domain.

item.title: Free .com or .net domains from microsoft office live beta!
item.dc:creator: @MTD MTD
item.description:
@MTD wrote:

Yes, it sucks for a number of reasons.

Everytime a company offers something on the internet, for free, they still ask for creditcard details. It’s probably because they want to stop faulty signups and to check whether people genuinely are who they pretend they are.

But on the other hand it sucks, because I don’t own creditcards. I’m not gonna get them either. If it’s really free, then why do they still ask for a creditcard, it’s stupid.

Secondly, some of the stuff on the signup forn has to be filled in to continue. They just don’t consider that some people like to keep it private for any particular reason.

Thirdly, it’s only available for USA people. There are some other countries that also offer you a beta signup, but most of the countries around the world are left out.

Lastly, I’d rather pay for a domain, than to get involved in some kind of scam. You never know what their intentions are when they suddenly decide to offer free domains. We always have had to pay for them, so why are they suddenly offering it for free. They definately want something in return in 99% of the cases.

Aside of that, it’s good that they actually thought about making domains for free, which I consider a great idea for the future. And no creditcards pl0x.

Read full topic
item.source: Free .com or .net domains from microsoft office live beta!

item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

From what I gathered, the domain is yours (in regards to your account’s) but it belong’s to MS…you can’t use the domain anywhere else…plus the MS free hosting only gives you 30mb diskspace.

Besides that, I can’t see anything else weird about it.
